intro: Hibiscus eriospermus, commonly known as the woolly hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Hibiscus eriospermus is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 6 feet, making it a striking addition to gardens. Its flowers bloom in summer and are often visited by bees and other pollinators.
